metadata.synopsis: An unnamed author of children's books (Madeleine Stowe) is woken from her bed in the middle of the night and taken from her home to a bland office where she faces an unnamed interrogator (Alan Rickman). Her book -- about a young girl who has been locked in a closet as punishment and the innocent creatures she meets there -- has been accused of harboring hidden anti-government messages. As the interrogator and his victim spar, secrets are revealed that raise even deeper questions.

reviews: Strong performances by Rickman and Stowe, yet the film (about torture) fails to engage on a visceral level
Rickman and Stowe add a lot to this fascinating little mind-bender.
I am of course opposed to torture, but I preserve sufficient irony to be offended by the smugness of this film.
